avalancheActivity.comment: Human triggered slab avalanche in Hrafnbjörg by Skriða, 10-12/4. Natural avalanches in SW aspects around Skjaldbreiður that have released in the last weeks.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is considered rather stable. Cornice collapse could happen causing small slab avalanches where slabs persist. Thin snow cover and risk of slip and slide falls. Short lived snowfall followed by rain directly after on Friday, with chance of wet avalanche activity.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Old windslabs are possible on firn high in mountains, especially inland, but the snow cover is mostly considered stable. Cornice collapse is possible and potentially could initiate small slab avalanches where wind slabs persist. Thin snow cover and risk of slip and slide falls. Chances of wet avalanche activity on Friday/Saturday.

travelAdvisory.comment:
Continuous NE storms in the last few weeks have accumulated alot of snow, especially in high elevations and has foremed a layered windslab in many places. A weakness in the snowpack can still be found in the north but snow has become somewhat more stable elsewhere. Human triggerd avalanches are considered likely, especially in the north. 
Southerly wind, with warm temperatures and rain in the south and west on Friday, Saturday and Sunday, with increased wet avalanche activity.
travelAdvisory.highlights: A Weakness in the snow can still be found in N Iceland, but snow has become more stable in other parts. Thaw is expected on Friday, Saturday and Sunday, with chances of wet avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: Vestan eða breytilega átt dálitlar skúrir eða él til fjalla á fimmtudag en snýr í SA-átt með slyddu eða snjókomu til fjalla á föstudag en snýr svo í SV-átt á um kvöldið og rignir í fjallahæð. Áfram SV-átt, hlýtt og rigning með köflum á laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Couple of small avalanches in Kirkjubólshlíð, NW-aspect, fell early last week. A small slab avalanche also fell from Skollahvilft above Flateyri 7th April.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is layered in the forecasting aera and new windslabs have formed in N/NE wind and drifting snow on Sunday. A weak layer can be found in the snowpack even though most places they do not seem very touchy. Thaw is forecasted on Friday and during the weekend and wet avalanche activity is expected.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has been added in three storms, from mid-March, during Easter and last week. Snow has drifted in N- and NE- wind during the weekend. No thaw has occurred and thick windslab have formed in gullies and lee sides of mountains. They are considered rather stable in most places, but if avalanches would release, they might become large. People travelling in steep slopes and gullies might trigger avalanches, especially where the weaknesses are shallow, i.e. in convex landscape features and around cliffs or rocks. Snowpit from the area confirms the presence of weak layers in the snowpack. Snow is expected to become wet during the weekend with possibility and wet avalanche activity.

travelAdvisory.comment:
Continuous NE storms in the last few weeks have accumulated alot of snow, especially in high elevations and has foremed a layered windslab in many places. A weakness in the snowpack can still be found in the north but snow has become somewhat more stable elsewhere. Human triggerd avalanches are considered likely, especially in the north. 
Southerly wind, with warm temperatures and rain in the south and west on Friday, Saturday and Sunday, with increased wet avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt og stöku él á fimmtudag en snýr svo í SA-átt með rigningu í neðri hluta hlíða en snjókomu eða slyddu ofar en þegar líður á daginn hlýnar og rigning nær hærra upp til fjalla. Sunnanátt, einhver væta og hlýtt í veðri á laugardag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Several slabs in E-NE winds on Thursday-Friday and a big slab avalanche in the NW-winds on Monday in Fljót. 10. April: Skier triggered slab (Sixe: 2, elev: 600 m, aspect: SSE) in Bæjarfjall. 9.April Skier triggered slab (Sixe: 2.5, elev: 600 m, aspect: S) in Bæjarfjall. Natural avalanche cycle size 2-2,5 in SE-SW aspect on april 7th and 8th. Many human triggered avalanches were released the days after the Easter-snowstorm and many big natural slab avalanches occured during the snowstorm
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs from E-NE winds Thursday-Friday and NW-winds on Monday. Decreasing stability due to warming on Saturday

snowpackStructure.highlights: Prevailing NE winds and heavy snow accumulation have built up layered windslabs. Snowprofiles still shows PWL at the  interfaces between windslab and firn and inbetween windslabs as well. A snowpit from Ólafsfjörður 16th of april showed a pwl below a mf crust at the surface of the old firn which failed with medium load and gave sudden planar fracture. This weakness may be at significant depths due to heavy snow accumulation lately so avalanches released down on the firn could be large. New windslab formation Thursday-Friday in E-NE winds and NW-winds on Monday.

Southerly wind, with warm temperatures and rain in the south and west on Friday, Saturday and Sunday, with increased wet avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: NA-læg átt á fim með skammvinnri snjókomu, snýst í SV-átt með hlýnandi veðri á föstudagskvöld, snjókoma til að byrja með en þiðnar svo uppá fjallstinda

avalancheActivity.comment: Several loose avalanches seen by Neskaupstaður on Tuesday and Wednesday. Few small avalanches have been seen around the area after last weeks snowfall and warming. On the 7th of April, a rather large slab avalanche released in Harðskafi above Eskifjörður during a NE storm. Wide slab also released in the northern part of Mjóifjörður.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Considerable amount of snow remains high in the mountains and inland after a NE snowstorm from the last weeks. Weaknesses can be expected between wind slabs of different hardness. New snow in places in the forecasting area and loose avalanches released on Tuesday and Wednesday. Thaw is forecasted this weekend with chance of wet avalanche activity.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of snow has accumulated in high elevations, NE snowstorm from the last weeks. The snow is layered, with windslabs of different hardness where a weakness could persist. A weakness deep in the snowpack could still be found in high elevations. In lower elevations the snow is mostly accumulated in gullies but firn in places. In places a rather thin layer of new snow has accumulated in light wind with chance of loos avalanche activity.

weatherForecast.highlights: Norðlæg átt á fimmtudag og þurrt að mestu, snýr í suðlæga átt á föstudag með hlýnandi veðri fram yfir helgi með lítilsháttar rigningu.
